{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Linksys |model=RE6300 |asin=B015Z3OD22 |newegg=N82E16833124603 |price=80 |series=AC750 |fcc_date=09/17/2015 |manuf_country=Taiwan |is_manuf=No |manuf=U-MEDIA |manuf_model=WST-C43L |manuf_rev=E00 R01 |type=range extender |fcc_id=Q87-RE6300, Q87-RE6400 |ic_id=3839A-RE6300 |pwr_v=100-240 |pwr_amp=0.5 |pwr_conn=C7 |pwr_ac_hz=50/60 |cpu1_brand=MediaTek |cpu1_model=MT7620 |fla1=16 |fla1_brand=Winbond |fla1_model=W25Q128FVSG |ram1=64 |ram1_brand=Nanya |ram1_model=NT5TU32M16EG-AC |wi1_chip1_brand=MediaTek |wi1_chip1_model=MT7620 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=MediaTek |wi2_chip1_model=MT7612E;MT7612EN |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=1 |wi2_rxchains=1 |wi2_sstreams=1 |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=Realtek |eth_chip2_model=RTL8211E |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=1 |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac }}
:• '''433''' Mbps - 1SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ac#Data_rates_and_speed 802.11ac] (80MHz chan.), :• '''300''' Mbps - 2SS 2.4GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11n-2009#Data_rates 802.11n] (40MHz chan.) = '''''750 Mbps'' class'''
{{TagLine|AC750 Boost Wi-Fi Range Extender}} :{{ProductPage|https://www.linksys.com/us/p/P-RE6300/}} {{SupportPage|vendor=Linksys|model=RE6300|pid=01t34000003qRplAAE}} The same hardware is used for this device and the [[Linksys RE6400]] but :this device must be limited to single-stream 802.11ac operation. Chip IDs in the FCC photos are illegible. Some details taken from :[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=1084956 this thread] on the DD-WRT forums. The U-MEDIA part number '''0500-''' is obscured by the ethernet port. :A label affixed to the FCC EUT indicates the internal '''U-MEDIA''' :model is WST-C43L E00 R01 {{WiFiCert|WFA61408|07/21/2015}} :- Access Point for Home or Small Office (Wireless Router) {{WiFiCert|WFA61409|07/21/2015}} :- Game Console or Game Console Adapter {{see also|Linksys RE6400|U-MEDIA}}
